task.title: Straightening a Bent Front Axle
task.shortdesc: Guidelines for straightening a front axle or spindle after an accident.

prereq.note: Professional repair is strongly recommended for bent axle components.

context.p: Proper alignment of the front axle is critical for vehicle safety and tire wear. Visual inspection alone is not sufficient to ensure proper straightening.

fig.title: The Spindle and Front Hub Assembly

image.alt: Image showing all of the parts of the spindle and front hub assembly.

step.cmd: Assess the damage to the axle or spindle.
If attempting repairs yourself, straighten the components cold.

info.note: Do not apply heat to the forgings as this will compromise the steel's tempering.

step.info: Refer to procedure #90 for wheel alignment specifications.

result.p: When properly straightened, the wheels should be in perfect alignment to prevent excessive tire wear.

postreq.note: For best results, return damaged components to an authorized dealer for straightening using specialized jigs.
